alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 11:35AM MST until July 28 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Sawtooth and Superstition burn scar in... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 345 PM MST. * At 1135 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Sawtooth and Superstition Burn Scar. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Sawtooth and Superstition Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Sawtooth and Superstition Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mesa, Apache Junction, Gold Canyon, Superstition Mountains, Kings Ranch, Gold Camp, Lost Dutchman State Park, Goldfield and Queen Valley. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 193 and 202. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
